div.head: To his much respected friend Mr. JOHN WILD.
div.p:
BY your favor I am come to make good a promise which in this dedication is partly (though weakly)
performed: your sweet respects did embolden mee to make it, and now an assurance of your kinde acceptance hath (as I may terme it) made mee presumptuous to performe it: you shall meet here with a bundle of merry conceits, which, while they were in my selfe, were my owne Recreations; but are
now expos'd at all adventures to bee the mirth of others. For the readers part, I hope he is gentle, and will make a charitable construction of a thing intended only for Recreation: and for yours, if it may finde a faire entertainment, it will make me ambitious (if occasion bee) to be your servant in some other
